text: Amazon recently announced the general
availability of the Amazon open search
service zero ETL integration with amazon
security Lake a new integration that
makes it simple for users to keep their
data safe gain actionable insights and
query logs in security Lake without
having to move
data through new capabilities to search
analyze and spot potential security
threats Amazon's open search service and
amazon security Lake integration helps
customers unlock the full potential of
their security data let's dive deeper
into how this integration can benefit
users and how to get
started zero ETL Integrations facilitate
point-to-point data movement without
needing to create ETL data pipelines by
connecting different data sources
directly customers can access the right
data when and where they need it in a
single tool and a single schema the data
is also ready to use for analysis and
querying across data silos without all
the usual prep work like data movement
the open search service zero ETL inte
with security Lake uses the rich
analytics capabilities of open search
dashboards to query and visualize data
in security
Lake often customers face challenges
with data and analytics like increased
system complexity additional costs and
delayed time to
investigation because the open search
service and security Lake integration
simplifies data architecture and allows
for new data sources without needing to
reprocess it it reduces data engineering
efforts while also enhancing
agility this integration is is also
Cloud native and scalable which means
customers can reduce infrastructure cost
and development efforts while optimizing
costs based on actual usage and data
processing
needs finally this zero ETL integration
provides faster time to insights unlike
traditional ETL zero ETL provides
realtime or near realtime data access
which ensures fresher data for analytics
AIML and Reporting more accurate and
timely insights means businesses can
rapidly innovate and make better
decisions based on the right data
customers can optionally boost query
performance by enabling additional
accelerations like index views and
dashboards in open search service this
provides complete visibility into all
your data stored in security Lake
regardless of the log
volume to get started customers will
need to create an Amazon security Lake
data source integration in open search
there are a few prerequisites that
customers will need to meet before
starting this integration please refer
to the AWS doc creating an amazon
security Lake data source integration
and open search service for instructions
on how to enable security Lake set up
security Lake permissions and share
security Lake data sources with Amazon
open search both within the same account
and cross accounts once these
prerequisites have been met head to the
open search service console and choose
the connected data source in the data
connection section click on connect data
source you can then choose security Lake
as a data source type you can choose to
create a new am role or use an existing
I am role next select the glue database
table review your configurations then
click
connect after this connection is created
select explore logs to view security
Lake Logs with the open search Discovery
tool from here select view all available
data select security Lake and the data
connection you created in the previous
step you can now choose which table you
would like to query in security Lake as
an example I have selected AWS Waf logs
from there choose the query language
that you want to use and then write and
run your query you can find sample
queries in the top right corner of this
page there is a query library with over
200 sample queries to choose from which
is great to check out if you're just
getting started there is also the option
for you to create an index view for data
that you run frequent queries on you can
also create open search dashboards for
your security Lake data go back to your
connected data sources page and select
create dashboard to get you started we
have launched pre-built open search
dashboards for VPC flow logs Waf logs
and cloud trail logs for your security
Lake
data and that is it for the demo the
Amazon open search service and amazon
security Lake zero ETL integration
eliminates the need to move data and
provides a way to gain insights query
logs and visualized security information
in one place if you would like more
information email us at awsd detection
and- resonse amazon.com thank you for
watching
